page.title: 09Farming near Exmoor(cont)
page.content: Most land is marginal,with no Grade I and Grade II land and with very little in Grade III.An insignificant proportion of the farm area(2%) is devoted to arable crops,and then not for cash sale,but almost entirely for wwinter feeding of stock. Though grassland,including rough grazing, almost completely covers the area,less than 30% is suitable for harvesting hay or silage for winter fodder. Woodland covers about 200 acres(7%) with deciduous trees on about 80% of the wooded area.Most are indgenous species,largely self-generating but providing very little farm income.However their amenity value is high and they contribute greatly to the exceptional beauty of this area.
